did.unittitle: New York Association of School Psychologists Records
did.abstract: This collections documents the day-to-day activities and operational materials of the New York Association of School Psychologists (NYASP) ranging from administrative materials, event records and resource materials for members.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection includes newsletters, fiscal materials, minutes and agendas, conference materials, administrative materials, correspondence, organization case studies, physical materials, audio-visual materials, screening tools, position papers, legal counsil, legislative lobbying materials, member resource materials, presidential record materials, event planning materials, reports and announcements, and organization history materials.

This collection pertains primarily to records following the consolidation of School Psychologists of Upstate New York, SPUNY, and the New York Association of School Psychologists, NYASP. This consolidation of the two organizations into the New York Association of School Psychologists, NYASP, occurred between 1981 and 1983. While there are some records from this earlier period, they are few in number and primarily pertain to newsletters, member resources, correspondences, and announcements rather than daily operations, and activities.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The New York Association of School Psychologists (NYASP) is the organization which represents school psychologists throughout the State. It is divided into geographic chapters, each of which holds local meetings, often with presenters on current issues in the field. As a statewide organization it also holds an annual two and a half day conference. The organization employs a legislative consultant to remain abreast of pending legislation which has an impact upon children, families and schools, and it holds an annual lobby day to meet with senators and assemblypersons. The NYASP publishes a newsletter three or four times a year.

Until 1983 there were two school psychology associations in New York State. NYASP covered the downstate area and the School Psychologists of Upstate New York, SPUNY, covered the remainder. The two organizations then merged into one association, NYASP, in 1983.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives by Ruth Steegmann in 2017 and 2019.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Liam Sperrazza (2024).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites. Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder. The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks. The Department of Special Collections and Archives is eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is organized alphabetically. There are no series.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, New York Association of School Psychologists (NYASP) Records, 1972-2019. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the NYASP Records).
